conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height and thickness, rooms read as volumes, and the view is an elevated/isometric angle with the roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with coherent corners, visible floor plane, and clean cutaway. Minor simplification in some wall junctions/trim.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: detached garage on right, two bedrooms on right side, living/dining on left, kitchen/bath core near center. Some plan features appear simplified/omitted (e.g., balcony/entry detailing and small service areas), and a few wall lengths/room proportions look approximate rather than dimension-faithful.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen counters/sink are present, but most furniture (beds/sofas/tables) and bathroom fixtures are largely absent or extremely minimal, limiting room identity verification.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean rendering with readable walls/openings and good visibility. Materials are consistent and background is uncluttered; minor ambiguity in some door/opening details due to simplification.

detected_errors.description: Some layout/proportion simplifications vs the 2D plan (notably small ancillary/edge features such as balcony/entry/service details) reduce strict dimensional fidelity.
Several doors/windows are simplified; exact placement/swing/orientation cannot be confirmed for all openings against the 2D plan.
Most major furniture and bathroom fixtures are missing, limiting verification of room functions beyond the core layout.

summary: A genuine, clean 3D cutaway that broadly matches the 2D layout, with moderate geometric simplification and limited interior fixtures/furnishings.
